question: Triple-drug therapy with the long term aim of eradicating lymphatic filariasis was recently launched in Nagpur. Which of the following statements is/are true regarding the therapy? 1.The treatment is known as IDA and involves a combination of ivermectin, diethylcarbamazine citrate and albendazole. 2.The plan is to administer these drugs for two consecutive years. 3.Over 40% of worldwide cases of Lymphatic filariasis are found in India. Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: The World Health Organization is recommending three drug treatment to accelerate the global elimination of lymphatic filariasis. India has missed earlier deadlines to eradicate the disease by 2015 and 2017. The global deadline now is 2020.
